page.title: 14HOUSING AND POPULATION
page.content: The population in the designated area is concentrated in Brockworth Village and Shurdington Village,with isolated small settlements of one or two houses and farms. Brockworth consists of a Council Estate to the East and Spec.building mainly to the West,built mostly during and after the 1939-45 war.The Council Estste consists of terraced houses,some of which have attractive gardens.To the West are some town houses,a few detached,but mainly semi-detached.There is no village green but there is a large recreational field.Some prefabricated houses remain. There is a large house,Brockworth Court,mentioned in the original Domesday Survey,built about 1430 adjoining the church.The Tudor portion remaining is of beautiful architecture
